comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: From the University of British Columbia's Chung Collection site: "[Wong Sun Yue and Ella May Clemens] met in the aftermath of the 1906 San Francisco earthquake and subsequently married. They opened a curio and tea shop in Chinatown and published a series of postcards of themselves to promote the store. For more information, see Bowen, Robert W and Brenda Young Bowen, San Francisco's Chinatown (South Carolina: Arcadia 2008), 41-6." chung.library.ubc.ca/collection/details/9126 This looks like it could have been taken inside their shop at 535 Grant, San Francisco. Another of these postcards was posted by Flickr User breefriendly: A more detailed story of the Wong Sun Yue Clemens' life in San Francisco, including their marriage, which was illegal in its day, is at: roundbarner.com/main/index.php?option=com_phocagallery&am...

comment._content: artolog: thanks for the background information.  We may include it in the record at the next update.
